prism

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.Tile

  • public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a face (or a part of face) of a Pareto curve or its underapproximation, given by it's corner points. The number of corner points must be equal to the dimension, e.g. a line in a 2d, and a triangle in 3d. So for example a square face must be represented as two triangle Tiles.

      The corner points that determine this Tile

      protected boolean[] projectionUpperBound 
      protected boolean upperBound
      If true, this tile is already known to be part of a facet of a Pareto curve, not just it's underapproximation.

      • processNewPoint

        public boolean processNewPoint(Point point,
                               boolean updateUpperBounds,
                               int upperBoundsIndex)
                        throws PrismException
        Returns true if this tile will be changed when point is added to a parent TileList. If updateUpperBounds is set, then also the information about the tile lying on a pareto curve is updated
        Parameters:
        updateUpperBounds - If true, the new point does not split the tile, and the tile's corresponding hyperplane was suggested, then the information about the tile being an upper bound is updated. This can be either information for the whole tile or its border lines, depending on upperBoundsIndex
        upperBoundsIndex - If equal to dim, when the information about this tile being an upper bound is updated, the whole tile will be marked as upper bound. If lower than dim, only the line having zero value in upperBoundsIndex-th coordinate will be marked as upper bound
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • splitByPoint

        public java.util.List<Tile> splitByPoint(Point point,
                                         java.util.List<Point> otherPoints,
                                         double tolerance)
                                  throws PrismException
        Returns a list of tiles that should be added to the parent TileList when point is added, replacing the current tile. For the computation to be performed correctly, the list otherPoints must contain the set of points from all affected tiles.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - When the newly created tiles will differ only in a point which is tolerance far from the original tiles, the new tile will be considered finished.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getWeightsForTile

        protected static Point getWeightsForTile(Tile t)
        Gets a weight vector representing the hyperplane given by the tile.
        Parameters:
        t - The tile to compute the weight vector for.
        Returns:
